Event.0: BC Roman Republican Leader Octavian, later Augustus 1st Roman Emperor, marries Livia Drusilla
Event.1: American-born chess player Bobby Fischer, who became the youngest grandmaster in history when he received the title in 1958, died in Reykjavík, Iceland.
Event.2: A large-scale earthquake struck the Ōsaka-Kōbe (Hanshin) metropolitan area, killing an estimated 6,400 people and causing major damage.
Event.3: Operation Desert Storm begins, with US-led coalition forces bombing Iraq, during the Gulf War
Event.4: NFL coach Jimmy Johnson (46) divorces Linda Kay Cooper after 26 years of marriage
Event.5: Supreme Court rules (5-4) that private use of home VCRs to tape TV programs for later viewing does not violate federal copyright laws
Event.6: "I Write the Songs" by Barry Manilow hits #1
Event.7:
Jim Carrey
Canadian comedian and actor
was born
Event.8: United Nations Security Council holds its 1st meeting
Event.9: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill and U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt met at Casablanca, Morocco.
Event.10:
Muhammad Ali
American boxer
was born
Event.11: American professional boxer Muhammad Ali was born in Louisville, Kentucky.
Event.12: American actor James Earl Jones, whose deep, resonant voice lent an air of gravitas to many roles, was born in Arkabutla, Mississippi.
Event.13:
James Earl Jones
American actor
was born
Event.14: Comedian George Burns marries comedienne Gracie Allen
Event.15:
Betty White
American actress
was born
Event.16: American actress Betty White, who was best known for her comedic work on numerous television shows, was born.
Event.17: The United States purchased three of the Virgin Islands—St. Thomas, St. John, and St. Croix—from Denmark for $25 million.
Event.18: Rodman Wanamaker organises a lunch to discuss forming a golfers association (later the PGA) at the Taplow Club, Martinique Hotel, New York City
Event.19: Captain Robert Scott's expedition arrives at the South Pole, one month after Roald Amundsen
Event.20:
Al Capone
American gangster
was born
Event.21: American gangster Al Capone was born in Brooklyn, New York.
Event.22:
Hawaiian monarchy overthrown
Acting for Hawaiian sugar interests and their American allies, a committee led by Sanford Ballard Dole deposed Hawaiian Queen Liliuokalani this day in 1893 and installed a provisional government with Dole as president.
Event.23: A group of Modoc warriors defeats the United States Army in the First Battle of the Stronghold, a part of the Modoc War
Event.24: Religious leader Joseph Smith Jr (21) weds church group movement leader Emma Smith (22) in South Bainbridge, New York
Event.25: English poet and novelist Anne Brontë, sister of Charlotte and Emily Brontë, was born.
Event.26: Captain James Cook becomes 1st to cross Antarctic Circle (66° 33' S)
Event.27: Augustus III was crowned king of Poland.
Event.28: American author, inventor, and diplomat Benjamin Franklin—who, as one of the foremost Founding Fathers, helped draft the Declaration of Independence—was born.
